description:
I just found a new favorite bubble tea place! I got the osmanthus tea with tiramisu foam. I got it with 50% sweet and 50% ice and it was perfect to my taste. I will be back to try more!

Note to self: Drink in the morning. I had it at 6pm and I couldn't sleep till 5am!!!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
This place is very spacious for a boba shop.

My orders:
-Uji matcha with cheese foam: the matcha was pretty good, but you have to mix the foam in order to taste it. This isn't Happy Lemon style where you just sip.

-Oolong milk tea: the tea is weak, as previously mentioned in another review. "It tastes more like flavored milk," is what my brother said. I personally agree. 

Sweetness is adjustable, and there are plenty of options here. 

I'd come back for convenience, but would stick to the matcha drink.
author: Corinna T.

description:
Owner is super friendly and nice! Drinks are always delicious but not super expensive either. Theres a nice variety of music and the cleanliness is good too!! 
I'd definitely recommend the matcha drinks with cheese foam, I cant go back to another drink. 
They're also multilingual which is really cool for my parents that come here.
author: Kelvin I.

description:
Maybe I came on a bad day, or picked the wrong drinks? My friend had recommended this place as her favorite boba shop in SF, so my expectations were higher than usual. We got the Lemon Yakult, Earl Grey Milk Tea and Jasmine Green Milk Tea.

The Jasmine Milk Tea is interesting since they put a hint of matcha in it. It was a little strange since it wasn't a fully Matcha drink and it wasn't a fully Jasmine Milk Tea drink so I think my tastebuds were confused

Unfortunately, everything tasted a little watered down, so probably wouldn't come back or recommend this place :/
author: Sarah C.

description:
I came here to try the newest trend, cheese foam. I ordered the cherry blossom milk green tea with boba and added cheese foam for an extra $1.25 to my drink. When I asked them for a spoon for it, they gave me a shovel, which I thought was a really cute and unique touch.

The foam itself definitely tasted like cream cheese and by itself, I think it was fine. I expected it be airy, but it actually tasted quite heavy and I don't think it went with my drink. As for the tea, I wouldn't say it's anything special - just your regular ol' milk tea with boba. I would much rather go to another place if I wanted really good boba, but trying out the cheese foam was definitely worth it for the uniqueness of it. And the shovel, of course! 

I don't think I would come back here anytime soon, but it's a worth a try. I just found the foam a bit too heavy for my liking.
author: Navie N.

description: I've always been curious about this place because of the cute mascot on their sign and while it's relatively clean and up to date inside, it's really mediocre at best. I ordered my usual milk tea and it was very meh. I've had better milk tea at Vietnamese restaurants that sell boba (you should know what I'm talking about if you know anything about boba). The selection isn't really that great either. So really, I think it's just bleh and you could do so much better with all of the other boba places nearby.
author: Jenn T.

description:
A typical milk tea location with above average tasting milk tea. The milk tea itself was very good, I fancy myself a milk tea enthusiast (although, I've been told otherwise by others) and thought it was of good quality. 

The location itself seems pretty big and spacious, I went a little bit before closing so there weren't slot of people. It seems like a good spot to get some work/studying done or just socializing with friends. I happen to notice that they have board games so I imagine people come and hang out for that as well. 

The service was fine, they were polite and friendly which is always key. It didn't take too long for my drink to be ready. 

Overall, I can see myself definitely returning.
author: Juan Carlos H.

description:
Pretty standard milk tea for a city full of boba options. I think Tancca is the only one in the nearby area that offers the creama/salted cheese option. 

Ordered a regular Assam Milk Tea with less sweetness and ice options. I like how there are a few tea options to choose from, but the milk tea was a bit bland and watered down. 

Amenities: bathroom, free wifi, games, & tables/seats.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Assam milk tea with their tiramisu foam IS OUT OF THIS WORLD. My drink was 50% sweet with no ice. Walked about 8 minutes to get back to the office and my drink is still cold! The lady in the back is very nice and friendly. The one who takes your order is also patient. 

I've had good and bad experiences here, but their food has outweighed the bad! Would recommend if you're in the area!
author: Teresa C.

description: This place is either a hit or miss. Been here a few times, at times the drinks are bomb af but other times... it's pretty water down. Wish the taste would be a little more consistent..
author: Emily H.

description: This is definitely up there for the weakest tea I've ever had. I got the roasted oolong tea at 50% sweet. I usually like my tea to taste like tea, which is why I get it less sweet so I can taste it and not just sugar but this drink tasted like straight up water. It tasted as if they had a cup of hot water and dipped a tea bag into the cup for 5 seconds and pulled it out. The tea definitely did not steep long enough for me to taste much of the roasted oolong flavor. My friends got some lemon tea drink and it tasted the same way like mine but with a hint of lemon. Probably save to say I will not be returning to this location. The staff was very friendly and was more than happy enough to adjust the drinks but it still wasn't to my satisfaction.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Service is horrible. Got there on Sunday afternoon and waited for the cashier 2 minutes. If you hire your employees to sit in the kitchen with their phone and not knowing any customer outside waiting, you better put a bell or something in the front. So customer will RING the bell for service. A girl glanced at me for two second and told another girl to take my order. The second girl finally came out with attitude on her face and got my order down. She told me they don't have enough change. I was like I don't mind $10 or $5s, but you gotta be kidding me if a milk tea store don't have change for $50. I believed I ordered my drink no sweet and no ice, she even wrote on the cup. No ice means NO ICE CUBE! My drink came out with few pieces of ice and not full.

PS to owner: Hire people who are willing to benefit your business please.
author: Kalum Z.

description:
I'm a bit surprised that this place got low reviews, but the drinks are honestly not bad at all. I came here before I went to do my nails to check it out.

I order the Apple Tonic with Lychee Jelly and my boyfriend got the Uji Matcha Salt Milk Foam with boba. The Uji Matcha was quite delicious, we got 100% sweet, but it wasn't too sweet at all and the milk foam went super well with the drink. My Apple Tonic was very refreshing and not overly sweet. This place is pretty decent because they don't drench their drinks with tons of sugar, it's the right amount of sweetness. I would definitely come back here again.
author: Natalie L.

description:
Tancca is my latest discoveries in milk tea. I was driving near Broadway and then I'm like WHATTT THERES BOBA HERE? I immediately parked and went inside to give it a try. I got the Jasmine milk tea with boba (There's matcha in there too. WAAAA :0) It was around $4.10 ish. They gave me a lot of boba. Which I liked :3. This place makes GREEN Jasmine milk tea o: Interesting haha! I really liked how I tasted the real tea taste other than the taste of sugar. That means a lot to me because I'd rather have tea over sugar. 

Overall... 

Drink: 4/5 

Matcha: 4/5

Boba: 5/5

Price: 4/5 

Customer service: 4/5 

Would I come back? Yes.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
# 14 Tanca *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars

Tancca has a nice vibe to it and the milk tea boba is a good not great option which causes it to land at #14 of 30 in my boba rankings below.

Rod M tours San Francisco in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  Check out my latest reviews for the most up to date list. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #30  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible
* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale. 
# 1 Itea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 9/9 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars 
# 2 Puppy bobar *Rod Boba SF Rating * 8/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars 
# 3 Asha Tea House *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/9 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 4 Caffee Central *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 5 Cool Tea  *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 6 The Boba Shop *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 7 Good Earth Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 8 Hanlin Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 9 Keep it *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 10 Wonder Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 11 Tpumps *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 12 The Ramen Bar *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 13 Sharetea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 

 
# 15 Boba Guys *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 16 Steep (not Steap) *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 17 T&T Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 18 E Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 19 Steap (not Steep) *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 20 Maggies Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 21 Sweet Heart Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 22 Honeycreme *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 23 Elixiria *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 24 Quickly *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 25 Plentea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 26 Mi tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 27 Ten Ren Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 28 Wonderful Foods/Dessert & Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 29 Out the Door *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 30 I Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
author: Rod M.

description:
I was craving some Jasmine milk tea, so I looked up the nearest milk tea places. Tancca came up, and I thought might as well give it a shot.

Once I finally got to order my drink, I got Jasmine green tea with pudding (nowhere on the menu it said that it would come with matcha). As they called my number, I got to the counter & saw that my drink was green, so I thought this must be a mistake. So I asked the lady why my drink was green? She replied that their Jasmine milk tea comes with matcha. At that point I asked if I could get it without matcha (pretty basic right?). She stated that she couldn't because its in their "policy". After listening to her pretty much yelling that it was her policy, she kindly replaced it for a cherry blossom milk tea.

The cherry blossom milk tea was bland and the milk taste overpowered the cherry blossom tea taste. The whole interaction left a really bad taste in my mouth, almost as bad as their milk tea.

Most likely not coming back here!
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: I really enjoy tancca! The drinks here are so strong and delicious! I ordered the uji matcha with cheese foam which was really good. It's a really filling and heavy drink so I recommend drinking this when you're hungry or want a heavier dessert/drink. They only have one size here but I think it's a good size for how heavy the drinks are. You can tell they use real matcha and a lot of it too!! The atmosphere is cute and they have this cool looking graffiti wall! I highly recommend coming here and trying the drinks. The service is good, the workers are all very friendly however it takes a while for the drinks to come even when it wasn't crowded. If you are in a rush I don't recommend coming here otherwise I would recommend trying it out!
author: Carissa C.

description:
I don't like to give bad ratings, but I was disappointed in my drink tonight. 

I ordered an apple tonic with boba and basil and got something that tasted like diluted sparkling water. It was really hard to drink and it was not sweet at all.

I think some review has an apple tonic drink and if you look at her picture, her drink looks green. But, if you look at mine, my drink looks red.
author: Victor L.

description:
I visited this place recently and I was so disappointed. I came here before when it was HiTea and I really enjoyed their drink and the puff they specialize in.

Before coming here on my recent visit, I checked it opens at 11am and I arrived just a few minutes before 12. I walked inside and there were 2 people preparing for the day. I asked if they were opened just in case I read the hours wrong and they said they were. I ordered Roasted Oolong Milk tea and it took them 10 minutes to make a simple drink. Once I stepped outside and sipped on my drink, I so regretted coming here since there are so many milk tea places in the area. My drink tasted like watered down milk!! There was no tea flavor whatsoever and I threw away my drink.

If they were honest with me and said they were running a little late that day and their tea isn't ready, I would have kindly told them I will go to another place and visit another day. I know for sure I will not be back.
author: Allie Y.

description:
The worst boba place I've try in SF. We got it at 7:30pm while they close at 8:pm and the cashier gave us a very disrespectful looking. More ridiculous that this place doesn't have boba ( as what the cashier said) while they have topping boba on the menu. The drinks were ok but the customer services is very disappointed. 
Never come back.
author: Nguyn J.

description:
Come here if you want to have your day ruined by people who don't understand the concept of customer service.

You can order milk tea with boba and receive it without any boba. You can ask why and have them tell you they ran out, like it's the most obvious thing in the world. But hey, they'll throw in the fun fact that they're making a new batch (which will be ready in 25 minutes!). Too bad you were planning a quick drink on-the-go. And you already have your drink in hand.

You can explain that you wouldn't have ordered any milk tea if you knew they didn't have boba. You can even ask for a refund like any logical person would. But surprise! They'll look you dead in the eyes and emotionlessly state "We don't do refunds" because you're worthless to them after you pay.

As you can see, I'm bitter because I haven't had my dose of sweet boba today.
author: Amy F.

description: Decent drinks for the area. I ordered matcha latte with puff cream- good. I've ordered their ice teas with boba and it's nothing amazing but I recommend telling them light on the ice. I haven't tried any of the snack items
author: Tasha L.

description:
Ever since this boba place got renovated, I been going here a lot lately to get some boba fix. I heard bad reviews on Yelp before that the last boba place wasn't that good and their service was Chinatown standards. When my sister showed me this place, I immediately fell in love with the Tonic Green Apple drink. The drink comes with popping boba and chia seed. And the size is a huge for its price! It is always my to-go drink whenever I am around the area. 

The place is pretty cute with an orange elephant mascot drinking tea. They offers range of tea flavors and snacks to eat. When I usually go the place, there's a lot of middle/high school kids that hangs out around. Other than that, its a cool spot to hangout and catch up with friends. 

If you have Five Stars and when you accumulate rewards at this place, the perks are great. Tancca offers free drinks as their promotion (esp when its your birthday) or free toppings. 

Also, there's free Wifi when you wait for your drink ;)
author: Judy M.

description:
This is probably a better place to stop for a drink in china town

Ordered a Thai milk tea with Tiramisu topping with 50% sugar. Their sugar levels are low compared to other places. Tasted more chocolate-ish which I didn't mind

My husband ordered a mango smoothie with mango jelly with 50% sugar and that was yummy. Will come back when I am in the area
author: Priyanka G.

description:
First time experiencing a tea based tonic. I got the green apple tonic with green tea. The actual tonic itself was fairly plain, but when you drank it with the popping boba at the bottom, it was like a pop of flavor that I didn't expect. I also liked how you can actually taste the flavor of the tea in the tonic.

Overall, it's quite a cute shop north of Chinatown with a different kind of boba menu than most places. I can see myself coming back if I'm in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Cassie Z.

description: The assam milk tea with puff cream is good but I made the mistake of getting 100% sweet. It was suuuuper sweet stick to 50% or 75%. But the puff cream here is really yummy and would def try adding the puff cream into a drink.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Saw this place on the way to dinner at The House. My family always gets boba after dinner.. so we decided to try this. It's definitely not as good as it seems. I asked for recommendations on the drinks and at first the cashier just pointed at the menu and I was so confused... okay which one...ALL??? 

I chose to get a jasmine green milk tea with puff cream. I assumed that it would taste like a creama or the milk foam drinks I usually get at Gong Cha or Sharetea. It definitely was not what I had expected. My drink came out green which confused me because I thought they accidentally made a matcha drink and I hate matcha. I guess it's supposed to look like that. The 'puff cream' was in my drink along the sides of the cup and I tried to shake my drink thinking it would mix together like it usually does at other locations, but it didn't. It just had a weird flavor and texture that I really didn't enjoy so much. I won't be coming again.
author: Sydney C.

description: Boba place does not have boba? You want what from customer? Very bad customer service, I asked what your recommendation, she said"Assam Milk Tea" that is it, and very unhappy with our choosing. Dang girl do you want to work? If no just go home. Bye!
author: Huy Q.

description:
"Where were these drink spots and fads when I was growing up?"

You can make a clear argument that a large majority of the blended Asian drink spots are very popular hangouts for the younger crowds. This new drink place is also a no exception. And just like the others, this spot is not much of a difference than others. The drink place serves your usual drinks, quick snacks, plus a few other unique items. 

I was here to get a quick thirst on. I grabbed a Milk green tea for $4.00. You can also request for the percentage for your sweetness. I liked mine fewer than 20%, because I plan to live as long as I can without diabetes interfering with my "beautiful and glamorous" life. The prices seem about reasonable. The place is best known for teas. I can actually taste the fermented tea leaf and not dealing with the artificial crap I find at other spots. 

However I do like the dark dining area with the huge TV and ESPN showing. But kids also hang out there socializing with others and play 13-card poker. 

There are many similar drink spots in Chinatown. But I think this is one of the popular and homely spots.
author: Matt G.

description: A heads up this review is based on the customer service only! I dropped by this place 40 mins before their closing time and the cashier said there is no boba because closing time is approaching. Not only that but she said that while having a straight face and didn't even said sorry, etc. With that kind of attitude I dont think I'll get anything from this place even when there is boba... attitude should be fixed pls!!
author: Kathy D.

description:
I hate to give new businesses low ratings but...

I came here and ordered the Hong Kong Styled Waffle and I got a Eggo Waffle with condensed milk. -_- Seriously? This place is seriously misleading.. I expected a waffle like the photo I saw on yelp NOT a Leggo my Eggo Waffle that I can get myself from the freezer at Safeway..

2 stars instead of 1 because the Osmantas Oolong milk tea was pretty good and I give them props for the wall decor..
author: Leilani Y.

description:
I liked this place overall. 

They have 2 huge TVs and areas to sit in front of them. In fact, I saw a bunch of people watching a basketball game in the area that was a little more hidden. When I say a bunch of people - I mean like 8 people. That's awesome. If I lived in SF, I'd hit this place up like a bar when it came down to watching games with my friends. Boba tea  + food + big TVs + lots of seating... what more can I ask for while watching a football/basketball game?! 

Got the Soy Matcha Latte - but it was called Uji/Umi? They label their teas differently. I had to ask what each one meant, haha. The boba was solid & the Soy Matcha Latte was great. I... think Boba Guys beats HiTea, BUT HiTea isn't a bad place to try if you're in the neighborhood. BF and I only stopped by since it was a walkable distance from hotel. I did hear Boba Guys has a huge line for drinks though (I can also verify this experience wise since I went to BOTH LOCATIONS!!!). So HiTea is a nice place to go as a sub

Waffle Fries are a good small app to eat while hanging out. 

Folks were very nice here. I think they tried to speak to me in Canto/Mandarin, but quickly realized I was Korean, haha. Everything came out at a good pace.
author: Rachel K.

description: The one star is for the super long wait when they only hire one person to work. It makes me mad, I waited 30mins for my two drinks when they are not busy. Won't come back since the wait is long for my two drinks.
author: Qing L.

description:
One of the better milk tea joints in the city, the sizes here are ginormous and it's rarely crowded. We just moved into the hood recently, so I've only known this place as 'Tancca' but it used to be called HiTea, which btw is an appropriate name for a 420 friendly city. :)

Tancca is the first place to have served me something new on milk tea - the Puff Cream topping. It sounds like it might be some kind of puff pastry but it's actually an eggy, milky, slightly sweet n salty thing that is all over the top and sides of the milk tea. It reminds me a bit of Japanese egg custard with a more runny texture. Imagine that on top and mixed in with your milk tea....

I usually get the Assam milk tea, 50-75% sweet, puff cream, and less ice. The sizes are generous so you could probably split one between two people. 

All in all, more authentic than places like Boba Guys - just go to Taiwan (birthplace of boba milk tea) and you'll notice all the Boba shops are more closely aligned to places like Tancca, not Boba Guys.
author: Henry W.

description:
This is definitely one of the better tapioca places in Chinatown. The place is clean and the decor is super cute. I love the lighting and the gold wallpaper with the cute drawings. There are tables and benches to sit at, which seem really nice and cozy. They have everything you need for drink option and toppings. 

I started with a hot lemon green tea and it tastes delicious. The lady at the cash register recommended what sugar level I should get so the tea wouldn't be too sour and she was right because it was spot on. 

I'm really excited to try more of their drinks. I'll definitely be back!
author: Kelly N.

description:
This place is good! They have puffed cream/milk foam and cheese milk foam options! If you've never tried those u should!! 
I come here for my milk tea fix and I'm never disappointed. I love the Assam milk tea with puff cream, 75% sweet, very little ice.
author: Zory M.

description:
I thought the boba here was good! The place itself is really cutely decorated and there's spacious seating inside.

I got the assam milktea with puffcream ($4). The serving size is large. This was the first time I had ever had puffcream. It reminds me of the pudding toppings you get only more condensed and really sweet. It was almost too sweet for me so if you get this I would recommend making your milk tea less sweet. I got 50% sweetness and still thought it was too sweet so I would try 25% next time.
author: Linda X.

description:
I think........this might be my favorite boba place?????

I always get the jasmine green milk tea with puff cream and egg pudding. The first time the girl recommended puff cream to me I was quite skeptical, but dear god it's delicious! It makes the milk tea super creamy and a bit salty.

I wish they had big sizes!!
author: Angela L.

description: Drinks actually taste really good. Ive been here several times and they've gotten my order wrong a couple of times.
author: Jassmyne L.

description: Rose milk tea with real tapioca pearl makes sipping like crem de la creme through the hollows of your mouth and tongue.
author: Angela T.

description:
I went there twice...first time I got the matcha with puff cream..which was pretty good..I would give it a four star indeed but then the second time I got a peach oolong tea with creama...when i got my drink I didnt think they put enough cream on top so I asked for more then the girl gave me a Sh!t face which i didnt appreciate...

for a start up u need to make sure ur staff are friendly and welcoming to expand ur clientele 

nice decor btw
author: Jessie L.

description:
Stumbled upon this place while walking around Chinatown with the bf. Decided to try it out since we were pretty parched. 

They do carbonated drinks with Boba, which was actually kind of interesting. They offered Yogurt in it, but we both thought that probably would have tasted awful had we decided to include Yogurt in it. 

We're pretty sure it was torani syrup for the tea we got since we saw the pumping, but I don't really care. It was a refreshing drink, pretty cheap and the Boba was good. Having good Boba is a big deal for us when we order drinks. 

Service was adequate, nothing to write home about. Not sure if we'd drive all the way out to chinatown just for this place, but I certainly enjoyed trying the carbonated tea drink with the boba in it. 

Entrance of store could use more seats in my opinion. A bit of an awkward set up with everything being more to the back and then a long bench kind of placed up front for people to wait. Seems like there's enough space to put in a couple more tables.
author: Jay K.

description: I give a 3 stars cause customer service and communication skills are all not within business & not showing or verbal communication appreciating customer business. The tea drinks  n Thai drink r good.
author: Ms R.

description:
This is definitely one of the better places in the Chinatown and Embarcadero area of SF. 

They take their creams very seriously and they definitely taste good. The milk foam (extra $1) with jasmine green tea was strong enough that the milkiness was not masking the tea. Definitely get 100% sugar because their levels are way less than other milk tea places (around 50% at other places) but the milk foam will make your drink a little sweeter. 

Prices are also reasonable and sizes are perfect.
author: Polly W.

description: I cannot explain my love for this place with words. I absolute love love LOVE the jasmine green milk tea with puff cream. It's creamy, rich, and just soooo good. I've tried krema, sea salt foam, other variations of this from other stores all over California and even in Seattle & Vancouver. None of them compare to puff cream and milk foam. I wish I could just steal their recipe. They have free wifi too!
author: Annie C.

description: I love the snowy strawberry because it has a fresh, creamy, sweet taste of strawberry instead watery like other stores.
author: Winnie H.

description: With the help of the kind employee, she suggested the snowy strawberry for fresh fruit. Knocked off one star because I wasn't the biggest fan of the boba; it was tasteless and a bit a hard to chew.
author: Sophie C.

description: This's the fourth time I came back here for the boba. The girls working here was so friendly and nice. Specially Susan, she helped me out which drink I should try and I love Royal Milk Tea with Tiramisu Milk Foam from her recommendation. OMG, I love that drink and I strongly recommend you guys come there to get your drinks. Awesome...
author: Liam T.

description:
Ehhh don't know what so say. 

Cashier lacks English, had to speak to them in Cantonese but they still messed up my order. Wanted to order their strawberry tea tonic but ended up with a strawberry icce, which was basically just a strawberry Italian soda.

The BF ordered a roasted oolong crema, that tastes way better than mine but it wasn't amazing. I ended up throwing my drink away 1/5 into my drink cuz it was not crackin...

Would not come back again. They do however have a big seating area so if you want to study here, I see it being a good study spot!
author: Kelly L.

description: Checked in here after get my nails done around North Beach area. Amazing drink I ever had. I ordered Rose Black Tea with 30% sweet, i love the way they mix with Tiramisu. Will be back then.
author: Kelly N.

description:
When a friend of mine mentioned a new milk tea shop in Chinatown, I didn't hesitate to find it on Yelp and walk over to give it a try within minutes. And by minutes, it was a 12 minute walk from Union Square to the outskirts of Chinatown.

The interior is spacious and cute. It's perfect for high schoolers to hang out and play games or study. (Just a cool story I thought I'd like to share)

What's interesting about these drinks is that they include "Asian puff cream" in their milk teas, which give it a sweeter and a tad thicker flavor (like sea salt crema) than most places. However, unless you have a sweet tooth, you will most likely have to cut down on the sugar, as the cream makes it pretty sweet already. I tried it once at 50% sugar, and again at 0% sugar. Personally, I'd probably go for 25% or 30% next time. In spite of the sweetness irregularity, I found the actual tea to be quite strong (a good thing in my book)! 

They also serve food, but in terms of milk tea only, it's an interesting concept, and I can see this place being a solid stop for milk tea in Chinatown. Not a place I would be frequenting many times, but I wouldn't say no to another trip to HiTea.
author: Viet N.

description:
I tried their original matcha cream puff tea, added boba and made it 50% sweet. The drink was perfection! I didn't know what to expect for the "cream puff" name but I would describe it as a cross between egg pudding and crema froth. The boba was cooked perfectly as well - just the right amount of sweetness and chewiness. 

Man, the drinks are quite pricey since I paid 5 bucks and some change for my one drink, but it was very fresh and made to order. Also, the store is hard to get to if you're driving through Chinatown, but I can't wait until my next trip back! The cafe is cute and spacious too but there's only a handful of seats for taking a break or perhaps studying.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
List of Offenses:

- Trash cans were overflowing.
- Restroom was filthy and the toilet seat wouldn't stay up.  Not that it mattered because there was already urine all over the toilet seat anyway.
- They got my order wrong.  I specifically ordered a roasted oolong milk tea.  They gave me an osmanthus oolong milk tea instead.
- Drink was bland.  Normally I'd be cool with trying something new and different, but this mistake didn't even taste good.  It was like drinking diluted milk poured into a cup with someone's unfinished, on-its-second-brew tea.
- There was a spider hovering over the mug.  Granted, this was just a mural, but why would you have such imagery in your food establishment?
author: Dave Y.

description: Came in for oolong milk tea with boba 50% sugar. The drink itself overall was really watered down. It had more ice than oolong milk tea. The flavoring overall just tastes too down and tastes more like water. Other than that, customer service was fast, drink was ok but they really need to improve on making the taste more attractive instead of it tasting more like water.
author: Brenda C.

description:
I was in SF and walking around ChinaTown with a friend, when we passed this place.  Not sure why, but somehow the name caught us, although we didn't initally go in because we were still being touristy and walking around.  This store is actually located just outside ChinaTown, and we happened to pass by it a second time and decided to go in.  I thought the place looked super clean and new, so I checked it out on Yelp, and yup, only a few reviews, so I guess this place just recently opened.

Their menu is not extensive like other places, but they seem to focus more on their teas.  At the top of the menu there was a section of drinks that all included milk puff, and when I asked about it, the cashier had a hard time explaining.  She basically said that it was similar to the salted cream you can get on top of drinks except it's sweet, and it goes on the bottom on their cups.  I was intrigued since I've never heard of this kind of topping before, so I decided to go with the Matcha Latte with Milk Puff with pearls.  My friend is lactose, so she was browsing through their tea options and settled on the Cherry Blossom Green Tea.

The wait for the drinks took a little bit longer than expected, but I was okay with that because I noticed that for my friend's tea, it was fresh brewed, so that was a pleasant surprise.  The total wait time I think took about 15 minutes, which might not sound like long, but at the time, we were the only customers in the store, so they could work on efficiency a bit.  Drinks are sealed, which is nice, and the cup and decoartion on the seal is quite cute as well.  Purely aesthetic, but hey it doesn't hurt to have a pretty cup to drink from haha.

First sip of my drink, the matcha latte is pretty much what you'd expect and not too sweet, so that was nice, but I had to sort of dig my straw into the Milk Puff to get a taste of it.  Oh boyyyyyy, this is some pretty good stuff.  A bit hard to explain, since I feel like this topping might be unique to this place.  It's a bit creamy with a slight sort of custard taste and sweetness, and it is like, so I guess that's why they chose to name it Milk Puff.  Not sure if this is some new topping from Asia, but I'm sold on it.  The pearls however could use some work.  They had a slight firm texture, which I like, but they kind of didn't have any flavor to them.  My friend's Cherry Blossom Tea was extremely floral and fragrant.  The flavor was wonderful, and I think she got it at 50% sweetness, so the bitterness of the tea came through, but it wasn't overbearing.

Overall, I definitely enjoyed my experience here.  My friend and I already discussed coming back sometime even though we're in South Bay, so SF is kind of a drive, but the drinks were great.  They also have a cheese milk foam that is also quite intriguing, so I'll have to give it a try next time.  I would have given 5 stars, except the workers weren't too great an English, so there were some difficulties when ordering, and initially, my drink didn't have pearl in it, so I had to ask them to remake it, even though I had already waited like 15 minutes, so -1 star for that.  But if you're in the area, you should definitely check them out, and try one of their yummy fresh brewed teas, or something with milk puff!!
author: Brendan D.

description: I've come to Tancca to grab some milk tea a couple times after work and have not been disappointed. The place is not hard to find as there's a giant orange koala sign outside in this Chinatown area. The milk tea is not exceptionally good, but not bad as well. It's a bit on the sweeter end so I would ask for less sugar unless you are in the mood for ultimate sugariness. The big plus about this bubble tea spot is that it has a clean and modern feel and has a pretty decent amount of seating in the back. I would recommend Tancca for those looking to sit down with a cup of boba in Chinatown to possibly chat with some friends or just chill.
author: Joshua M.

description: Amazing bubble tea and it's cheap! Got a snowy Mango. Cozy environment with bathroom and free WiFi. Able to relax and enjoy
author: Eric Y.

description:
Very meh boba drinks. We came on a weekday around 2pm and it was crowded with kids. It was definitely popping but not my scene as it was way too loud to enjoy a drink with friends. They took our order quickly but honestly there's not a lot of drink variety at this place. 

I got the rose milk tea and I barely tasted the rose flavoring. The milk tea was overpowering and there were remnants of leftover tea bits which left a very bitter taste in my mouth. 

Service was quick but that's all I can say. I would stay away from the milk tea drinks. Sad face.
author: Sarah I.

description: They rebranded this place lol, but the drinks are good and the pricing is reasonable and affordable! The puff cream is what really makes this joint unique and it's a great location to hang out with friends!
author: Lena T.

description:
Finally a decent boba place in Chinatown. I've always had to drive out to Richmond or Sunset for a modern boba with all my comforting amenities, but HiTea makes it a lot easier! 
No more standing in 15 min lines at Boba Guys (subpar btw), No more having to pay extra for no ice option at Sharetea in Meteron. 

Thank you Hi Tea!!
UjiMatcha with pearl no ice please!!!
One thing : close later please :)
author: Calvin C.

description: That lady was super unprofessional and she gave me the wrong order! I said with puffcream for my matcha drink. She said she didn't hear it. i asked her to add it. she said no puffcream in the store! how come? Anyway, I won't come again.
author: Winnie W.

description: I ordered two milk tea today. They all tasted good. And the atmosphere here is also good too. I recommend this place.
author: Liying H.

description:
We ended up here coming back from a show on a Sunday afternoon since our parking lot was right next to it.  There were a fair amount of patrons, but the line/wait went quickly.  It looks like it just opened, so it was nice to see so many plants (are they for luck?) and the decor was pretty interesting, though hard to describe.  

Our tea was . . . lackluster.  It didn't really have much flavor unfortunately.  Maybe I needed to specify?  I ordered just a regular black milk tea with boba and my husband order something with lemon in it.  Our boba was gooey and fresh though.

Would be come here again?  Maybe.  Perhaps they just need some time to iron out some kinks and get some flavor going.

*Standard service.
**Not cheap.
author: Sabrina A.

description: Avoid coming here if you don't have HALF AN HOUR to wait!!! I ordered 1 drink and 1 popcorn chicken and 1 wings. It took 32 min to receive my order. Never coming back. I recommend you go over to Cool Tea Bar instead. 1 star for the Assam milk tea but popcorn chicken was bland and I was only given 3 wings that was mostly breaded dough. Save your time and money and go elsewhere. We asked the girl in the back about the order and she rolled her eyes and had her coworker answer.
author: Noellee C.

description: I was pretty under impressed with Tancca. We came around 6 on Sunday, they were out of boba, and the doors were wide open, making it nearly unbearable to sit inside and relax. The tea was mediocre, and was pricier than other places just a few blocks away. I got the jasmine black tea and was pretty underwhelmed.
author: Ross S.

description:
Love this new boba place! Definitely a solid 4 stars. They are currently running a Valentine's Day promo- buy any 2 drinks and get 25% off your purchase! All drinks here average $3-4 dollars, which is reasonable in SF. They do not have as much drink options as other boba places around. Their menu pretty much consist of milk tea, tea (with milk foam/puff cream), tonic drinks (carbonated), and blended drinks. You can adjust the sweetness and ice level for this place! They also use FiveStars as their reward system so don't forget to sign in!

I opted for the White Peach Oolong tea with sea salt milk foam (50% sweet) and got to try the Passionfruit Snowy (100% sweet) as well. The bitter tea taste was apparent in my drink, which is great for tea lovers! I do prefer some sweetness for my tea though so I would go for full sweetness if you don't really like strong tea. The drink itself along with the milk foam was great! You can definitely taste the tea taste. The Passionfruit Snowy, which is pretty much a slush with milk added, was actually really good too! They have passionfruit bits and seeds in there and wasn't too sweet at 100% sweetness. They even have cheese foam as their option for the teas! This is my first time seeing this option at a boba place so I'm excited to try it next time. I will definitely be back for their solid tasting drinks!
author: Shanna C.

description:
HiTea is now rebranded as Tancca.

Whenever I visit Chinatown I always make a trip to this place for the 50% sweet Assam milk tea with puff cream and boba, I have never tried anything like it before. It's like an airier/foamier mix of the sweet custard filling in Beard Papa's cream puffs? Either way, it's so thick it sits on the bottom of your cup and I just end up scraping the sides of the cup when I'm done because it's so tasty. The boba has always been nicely chewy and sweetened. 

However, the first time I tried the salted cheese foam it was...sour. Like yogurt. I spent months thinking it was just a disgusting combination other people liked until I had the savory-sweet-thick perfection at Honey Lemon and read other reviews. I guess I actually just had a bad batch but I'm not willing to try it again here.

There's a decent amount of seating in the back, free wifi, and a bathroom. Seems like a good place to just hang around with friends.
author: Jenna L.

description: The teas were good. We got the matcha tea and a milk tea. They were not too sweet they were just right. I like that they are open until 11 since many places start closing at 9.
author: M Teresa C.

description:
I've been here two times and the first, I ordered a lemon yakult with boba and while I was drinking my drink, I found a piece of foil (probably from the yakult) inside and almost swallowed it. Choking hazard!!! It seems pretty dangerous if kids are drinking and are not aware of what's in their mouths. 
   The second down side is them not being professional enough, and don't know how to use the app five stars. Maybe because they just opened or they're just greedy? I tried telling them about five stars but they still didn't give me the credit or let me use the coupon.
author: Vicky S.

description: Friendly service with lovely deco inside. I got Agar Tiramisu and Don't regret about it. It was awesome drink I ever tried. Love this place.
author: Khoe T.

description: The most comfortable "milk tea store" in Chinatown :) Love their beverages. Great service :)
author: Jenny Z.

description:
I saw this place open a few months ago, did not have time to try it till today.

HiTea is a really cute place! It feels like one of those Anime cafés. Cashier is really nice and friendly.

Ordered a Roasted Oolong Tea with Milk Foam, super delicious, the tea flavor is very strong. Their Milk Foam some what taste like Sea Salt Crema, but a bit more on the sweet side. I customized my drink to 30% sweet and 100% ice, but when I got my drink, the ice level is a bit more on the low side. I wish my drink had more ice. 

Definitely will come back again next time I visit SF, but next time, I will try to order my drink to be 200% ice! ^w^)/
author: Miranda K.

description:
A new boba place on the outskirts of Chinatown and very close to Robert C. Levy tunnel. It is very easy to spot,  is nicely decorated,  and spacious lounging/waiting area for their guests. So,  why less stars? 

Their register is right by the door and they make their customers wait for quite a ridiculous amount of time even when there isn't a lot of backorder. When I arrived there,  there were two gentlemen before me waiting for who knows how long. They ordered together,  and I was surprised that rather than getting my order right after,  the woman had me wait a very long time before she eventually got to me. There was already a woman making drinks on the other end of the counter and another woman messing around with her coworkers. I understand that they do phone orders and they want to make their workplace fun,  but literally ignoring a customer right in front of you while messing with your coworkers is just plain rude.  

When I finally got my cherry blossom green tea without milk or cheese foam from the older woman on the other end of the counter (who was working hard the entire time in my opinion), I was a bit disappointed with my drink. Yes,  they allowed me to have no foam on top (their drink selection is pretty much either milky, foam on top, sparkling tonic, or thick smoothie), but the tea itself was rather bitter (bottom of the pot type of bitter) even with my lychee jelly topping masking it a tidbit.  

Personally,  based on my experience,  I wouldn't want to go again during my timed lunch break since it is a rather long process from start to finish.  I'd only want to go there to try a tonic or smoothie one day,  but not their milk teas.  Maybe someone else will like this level of service and type of drinks,  but it is not my type of place based on today's experience.
author: Christina L.

description:
I secretly don't want this place to get popular. Their counter is fairly short so I saw them brew my cup of milk tea-with a new tea bag! Yes, unlike some places, they actually make your tea to order! Their menu is unique (only tried classics so far but LOVE them all), their presentation is adorable, and even though at times it seems like they have more than enough workers it definitely pays off. I don't mind waiting time since I know tea takes time to brew, and it's not because there's 50 drinks in front of my pre-brewed, only-needs-to-add-syrup drink.

The drinks overall have a stronger tea taste even with full sugar, but I can trust ordering less sugar without expecting it to be watered down. $4 for perfect tea with the right amount of sweetener and soft toppings? Worth every penny in my book.

Parking is hard around this area, but I suggest the one right next to the police station on Vallejo where you can walk a block through the alley.
author: Betty Z.

description:
I had a good catering experience with HiTea. I called around 15 places to look for someone who could cater some bubble tea for my wedding. No one would deliver (or one place would deliver but it was expensive). Vivian at HiTea came through. 

She was prompt, the bubble tea was reasonably priced, and they even delivered and picked up the equipment afterwards.

I would say that catering may still be new to them, as half the straws they provided were too thin to drink boba with (and confused the guests), and the sugar provided came in a container that was really difficult to poor with, so was also confusing. Apart from those minor issues, the bubble tea was a hit with my guests! 

Really appreciate Vivian's flexibility with arranging this, and would work with her again!
author: Yan K.

description:
I was thrilled to find out that a new milk tea shop opened up a block away from my boyfriend's place.  Especially since Cool Tea seems to have shut down a couple of their locations.  That was my go-to for tea on the Chinatown/NB border.  But when we walked up to HiTea, we were awed by the shiny, new shop with the big adorable signage.

We were also totally puzzled by the menu!  Now I'll admit, I'd never had milkfoam or cheesefoam style tea.  I just haven't seen it around here.  The menu is puzzlingly, needlessly complicated.  I totally appreciate the level of customizability in drink choices--but the layout of the menu is bizarre.  The font is soooo small, the illustrations don't illustrate anything about the drink categories (because they're too small), but just take up space.  

So, here's the skinny.  Hopefully the owners figure out a way to fix the menu because it's bonkers confusing.  There's puff cream and there's milk foam.  Puff cream gets all mixed into your milk tea.  Milk foam sits on top.  There's two types of milk foam--salt milk foam and cheese milk foam and you can choose which kind.  If you want milk tea but you have a foam phobia, you can get it without the foam or cream and they call it "Classic Aromatic" on the menu.  If you want puff cream all up ins, it's called "Originate," and if you want milk foams all up ons, they call it a "Pure Milk."  I know.

If you want some of that salty foam or cheesy business, but don't want a milk tea, they have a Teaspresso called a "Pop Star."  If you're scared and confused you can just get a snow or "Italian Snow" or I'm not sure which it is because ITALIAN is capitalized on the menu but not Snow, so maybe it's just an "Italian."  If you're lactose intolerant then maybe try the "SPECIAL"  Iced Sparkle Tea or just take a Lactaid and live a little.

All that said, the tea is yummy, the shop is cute and spacious (for SF), and the staff is really nice.  I've been here like four times already.  I think my boyfriend would drink a whole cup of just cheese foam.  I really like the Royal Ceylon milk tea with pudding and pearl.  

Suggestion to the owners:  Do drink specials for people with ADHD who can't read your menu.  So they can just point at the board and be like, yeah I'll just try that I guess.  (Like how ShareTea just has a bunch of pictures of drinks up).  I guess I can only speak for myself, but I know I'd just randomly try whatever the drink of the day was.

Last but not least, @ The girl who posted outrage that her Matcha was made from powder--I hate to break it to you, since powder apparently gives your cousin mud butt or whatever.  But Matcha literally means powdered tea.
author: Angela Z.

description: They moved away from the nice plastic seals on their cups to the crappy, loose plastic lids.  The lid on my drink was so loose that my drink just dripped all over my hand as I was walking.  I asked them why they changed that, they said their boss wanted to change it.  Probably to save cost.  But, unless they changed it back to the nice plastic seal, I don't think I'll return to HiTea.  I'm highly disappointed.
author: Kev H.

description:
I absolutely love the Matcha Latte with Puff Cream.  I've had it twice and the puff cream does add a bit of sweetness to the drink so recommend trying it out with 50% sweetness.  The puff cream makes the drink really smooth and creamy.  

The café itself is super cute.  Love the Koala décor!  Drinks run about $4, decently priced for good boba.
author: Veronica N.

description: I've stopped here a couple of time when I've been in the area. I think that the plain tea is pretty good, but I tried the lychee black tea, and it pretty much just tasted like plain black tea, which was disappointing. I'll probably come back and try some other things though.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
With a new establishment you always need to be concerned that the reviews will be those of friends of employees or owners. However, I am no shill and my reviews are legit. I can say after trying this place on multiple occasions that this place does a few things pretty well and has become my go-to for tea in the area. 

First, the tea! Its probably the best in the immediate area (or at the very least tied with Cool Tea Bar). My favorite tea here is currently the peach oolong tea with agar boba. Its nice, and I can taste the strong tea flavor come through. The selection is not expansive as others tea places, but they do the tea and boba part well here. 

Ambience wise, It's all brand new and clean. Big plus! Also the space is pretty roomy. The tables and chairs are all in the back. This makes for a quiet and sort of private space to drink, study, converse with friends, etc. Every time I take a look, I see one or two people studying or working in this area. Its a decent space for sure. 

Hey, I'm in Chinatown. I can get lunch for under $5! That's why initially I thought that this place was expensive, but for boba the price is only slightly above average (but only very slightly). $3.75 for most of the drinks, extra 50 cents for additional boba toppings. I think they cups are decently big, so I think its an okay price. .   

The tea baristas are all very pleasant. I made a comment about how I should have signed up for five star earlier, since I only just recently signed up, and they credited me a few extra points toward a free drink or snack, out of kindness of their own hearts. Good service!

Finally, for snacks they don't have popcorn chicken but they have some chicken wings, and curly fries. The snacks are all about $5 or less, though I have not partaken.
author: Huy V.

description: The lemon tea is good even w/ barely any sugar. However, I wouldn't get the lychee black tea. There was barely a hint of lychee in it sadly. Aside from that, it's a nice place to stop by to take a break from the city.
author: James N.

description: perfect drinks with awesome servers. I love the way they mix Tiramisu with tea. they have lots of flavor of teas. Strongly recommend...
author: Sloan L.

description: Great for a late night snack, the girls that worked there were really friendly. Will come back soon!!
author: Claudia C.

description: I came here after seeing someone snap a picture of the Matcha Puff Cream.  I was intrigued and had to see what this puff cream was all about.  The store itself is really cute, the wall had illustrations on it. I was expecting the puff cream to be custardy and thick, but instead it is light and reminds me of the tea creama creme from Purple Kow.  It's good, but i was just expecting something more.
author: Emi K.

description:
I've been here several times already - milk teas are consistently good, and staff is consistently friendly. 
Milk tea and jasmine milk tea are both tasty, though not spectacular. Jasmine actually tastes a little like a mix of matcha and jasmine green tea. But their specialty stuff makes everything comes together great! Both the Cream Puff and crema (Himalayan or cheese) are very creamy and addictive. Milk tea (instead of tea) with crema is pure indulgence! 

However, I'm not sure how fresh and healthy the ingredients are-the crema is very thick and stays that way, but usually fresh cream melts pretty fast. So I'm not sure if the pricing is fair.

I have yet to try teas and boba toppings, but I will. Fried chicken wings comes hot, tasty and juicy.
author: Liz H.

description: First time I came here I got the avocado snow and it was more milky and wasn't sweet! Second time I came here I got the jasmine milk tea with puff cream and it was way better! Overall I'm glad that they opened this store near my house! A lot of seats on the inside! Pretty pricey for the drinks but the size is pretty big so it balances it out I guess (:
author: Tina C.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised to try popping boba in my drink. I enjoyed my lemon kumquat drink very much. You can adjust the sweetness of your drink to your liking. There's an April 2016 promo for BOGO 50% off drinks and you can join the 5star membership to get free drinks after purchasing a certain number. There is a large study/lounge space inside and two tvs. It may be cool to have some board or card games in the lounge area. 

While I do enjoy my share of chicken wings and French fries, I do wish there were more snack options besides fried foods. Perhaps include monthly specials like Cheung fun or curry fish balls?
author: W A.

description: Their tiramisu milk foam is awesome, must try!!! My favorite milk tea store when I was in LA, now I can get it in SF too, thanks God!!!
author: Xi H.

description:
This place doesn't have common flavors like taro or almond or lychee. I asked why and was told that they want to keep their drinks more "healthy" and that taro powder is mostly chemicals.

Guess tapioca and jelly is considered healthy. Huh.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Tried the matcha latte with puffcream and it was not good at all. It barely had any matcha in it and felt very watered down. When I got the drink I thought hmm it was barely green, but I thought it would be like the matcha milk tea from Gong Cha (which was barely green too). That was not the case. All I tasted was sweetness and I asked them to make it less sweet. The puff cream was different, maybe because I had never had it before but I decided it was not for me but might be for other people. Overall, I am not a fan. I would come back to see if it would be any different but it does not look like it from the other reviews. Minus one star for being overly sweet when requested less sweet. Minus one star for barely tasting the tea and being watered down. Minus one star for there 5 stars being down.
author: Mike G.

description:
I know this place because a family friend helped renovated on it. 
It's pretty cute: purple ceiling (MY FAVE COLOR), gold walls with hand painted Art Deco, it's not Pro but good enough. Then a orange koala, just there, sitting on the tree chilling. Black wood bench, tall table with tall chairs (HEART) 
I like their back room the most, cozy and relaxing however the pillows doesn't match the painting nor the feel. It seems they're still finishing, there was some tools laying around, some loose paint chips and that loose nail. 
It's a clean place, considering its new :D
Hopefully they will keep it neat, clean and clutter free and not overwhelmed their customers with 200 different drinks and food menus plaster all over their wall (don't be a quickly) 
Service was okay, there was 2 girls behind the counter, one elderly lady and a young lady, elderly lady looked at us and waited for the young girl to take our order. I don't know what that was about. 
Drink was ready within 4 minutes? they weren't busy so why 4 minutes for ONE DRINK. 
Practice makes perfect. 

Ummm ... Price is cheap (I think), range from $2.99-$4 (plus tax) from what I remember (didn't really care since I wasn't the one ordering, just wanted to seat and sneeze) 

First time- 3 weeks ago, free drink- regular milk tea with  some pudding like substance (later found out its puffcream) I don't know what to think of it. Idea is original but taste was weird. Not bad weird but interesting. It was too sweet for my taste, but my cousin likes it (she's a sugar maniac) 
Second time- Earlier yesterday, Matcha milk tea with 'PUFFCREAM'... ummm straight up powder! Cousin got the bubble guts, you know that's not good. I stop drinking after 4 sips and she forced me to drink 3 more sips so it's not going to a waste and she tried to finish it. 
Third time- Yesterday night, went with friends after dinner, they like boba too. Ordered salted coconut milk tea, avocado milk smoothie and grapefruit black tea with lychee jelly. All 3 is a fail. Friends didn't like it. Salted drink had no coconut taste. Avocado milk smoothie- 5% avocado and 95% milk and ice. Grapefruit Black tea- flat, watered down and why was there lotus seed inside?

Will not be purchasing my drinks here. Sorry : (

It's located in Chinatown, soooo parking will be difficult unless you're lucky enough to find and pay for meter or just parking garage (majority is $3 an hour or flat rate for $10/$15 or personal parking lot for $4/$5 an hour) 

I gave it 3 stars because it's a new place, clean and smelled nice. Price is cheap but for something that's bland yeah $2.99 is good enough. Service is alright, could be better in time. 
*whisper* there was a cute ish guy that night, I think he's the son or sorts of the owners because they were eating all together.
author: Fiona B.

description: I got the white peach oolong tea w/ boba. The tea is kind of bland and watery. Not much flavor and needs to be sweeter. There wasn't much taste in the boba either. I waited around 10 minutes for my drink which is pretty long. :/
author: Chris M.

description: Friendly staff, clean and super kawaii interior, and the drinks -- OMG I'M OBSESSED. I got the Uji Matcha milk tea (75% sweetness level) with agar and it was so freakin delicious!!! I will try it with the foam next time. I was able to try the Matcha Latte with puff cream and Jasmine Green Tea milk tea and they're both SOOOOO good too! All I can think about now is going back.
author: Isabele B.

description:
+1 star for the decor 

+1 star for the taste of our drinks (mango slushy)

-1 star for the girl at the cashier. I failed to read the menu to add toppings...I assumed my drink included boba. I wish she would've asked if I wanted a topping. Her voice was really soft and it was difficult to hear her. When my BF and I got to the counter, she didn't greet us or even smile. She made the situation worse when we waited for our change. My BF gave her cash and she failed to instantly return his change. She had the cash drawer open, register stated the amount of the change, but she didn't take action. Weird. (The change was significant- couldn't be considered to be a tip.) 

-1 star because it took about 10 minutes to get our drink even thought it wasn't busy.

-1 star because my BF ordered one type of drink and got another. Also, the menu has limited choices. 

Their koala logo is cute, but that's not enough to make me want to return.
author: Johan S.

description:
Today was the first time trying out this new place. I ord

ered the Jasmine green milk tea with lychee jelly. I didn't expect the drink to be green. The taste was bland and tasted like matcha green tea. They have limited drinks compare to other boba places. I feel like the drinks can improve. I'll give the other drinks a try and see next time! (2 stars)

UPDATE-
I started to like jasmine green tea with puffcream. I got normal sweet and less ice. It tasted very sweet so, i guess 50% sweet will be better. May 11, 2016.

Another new update, DO NOT get GREEN APPLE BLACK TEA TONIC. I saw that it has a star next to it, so i thought why not give it a try. I was wrong.... its sparkling flavored water and salted plum or something.
author: Tammy Z.

description:
3.5 stars!

I've been having a hard time finding decent milk tea in SF and after trying this spot today, my search continues. I ordered the jasmine green milk tea with pudding and was underwhelmed. The pudding had a firm consistency that I'm not used to and the drink itself didn't have a fresh tea taste. On the plus side, staff was friendly and my drink came out quickly.
author: Nancy L.

description: Finally got to try HiTea! My friends have been telling me to try them since they opened. The decor is super cute! I love that it is super spacious and aren't like all the other boba stores. Extra stars for the comfy couches in the back for me to study or play games :) I ordered the peach oolong tea with milk foam and it was freaking amazing!!! I have to disagree with the yelper below. There is a really strong tea flavor (i watched them steep the tea) and the milk foam was really creamy and mixed together with the peach oolong was really really refreshing!! I will definitely come back :)
author: Gracey J.

description: Changed their name to Tancca, I'm addicted to their Snowy Mango, salt and pepper chicken popcorn is not bad also
author: Roy O.

description:
Don't expect they have good tea! 
All Tea leaf are normal.. Taste too light... same as water...
I wouldn't go back!!!
author: Dee Z.

description: Came here a few more times and it's been consistentIy great every time! Not onIy that but so far every empIoyee I've spoken with each time was poIite, heIpfuI, honest, and cooI.
author: Paige C.

description: I haven't tried everything on their menu yet, but I'm in love with their Matcha Latte Puff Cream and Asam Milk Tea! I If you get the puff cream, make sure to get a lower percentage of sweet than you'd usually get because the puff cream makes the drink really sweet. The only thing I didn't love was the high mountain oolong tea - tasted quite acidic.
author: Margaret L.

description: stopped by just because it was on the path to where I was going, but have you ever had one of those places that are just hidden treasures? well this is one of them! I had one of my favs from every place I can find it "green apple slush" not alot of places can get it right but this one?? perfection!! plus it was suuuuuper busy but didn't wait to long and the staff was super awesome full of smiles and the hand painted deco is ill! I'm most definitely going back...great not I want one :/ haha
author: Rob R.

description: Milk tea was okay. Boba balls and lychee jelly was great but menu was a little confusing and the mango snow, avocado snow, and the raspberry sparkle drink were all super weird. Definitely would not come here again. Can find much better boba elsewhere
author: Eileen H.

description: Hate to give local/new businesses an okay review. I loved their popcorn chicken but their drinks aren't that great. Believe they're known for their boba drinks and snacks is a complimentary. Had the mango smoothie with lychee jelly and there was only flavor coming from the jelly. Completely no mango flavor, perhaps it had a weird after taste. Not sure what kind of powder they used, but will definitely be back for their snacks.
author: Angela L.

description: The Assam Black Tea needed to have more tea flavor. The drink and pudding were a perfect semi sweet.  Overall, I prefer a stronger tea flavor.
author: Roul L.

description: Must try their "snowy passion fruit"! It's almost to die for after a long day's workout.
author: Johnny N.

description: Customer service is always excellent here. I've probably been rung up by every employee that works here and I've never had a bad experience. My favorite is the matcha latte with puff cream. It's good with or without toppings; I feel the puff cream acts as a topping. If you do order a tea crema, it takes them a while to brew the tea individually. Which is probably a good thing, who doesn't want fresh tea? I haven't tried the other drinks they offer, but I'm pretty sure they are decent. Best boba you can find in Chinatown!
author: Jeanne C.

description: Got the uji matcha with red bean and half sweet which is pretty basic but good! The boba is also pretty good too and the drinks are not too expensive. Definitely would come back again(:
author: Colleen L.

description: Favorite milk tea place in SF so far. A lot of milk tea I got else where leave my mouth a weird sour taste but this one does not. I always get their Assam milk tea with Puff cream. Been getting their osmanthus oolong with Puff cream too. They don't recommend getting Puff cream over plain tea but I was being stubborn and wanted the combination. What can I say, I love it!
author: Anna X.

description: Absolutely perfect. I got the West African Cocoa with pearls and it was fantastic. A welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Sean B.

description: Excellent. Get the uhi matcha milktea! It is not your typical type of bubble tea place. It seems much moor authentic.
author: Jomel J.

description: I love trying new boba shops, I was iffy about the location but I'm glad I stumbled upon this place. I was confused what milkfoam and puff cream was, but the lady was nice and told me milkfoam was creama ( like other boba shops have ) and puff cream is something they specialize in and makes the drink smoother. I tried the matcha latte puff cream, and it was really good. Wish more places had this puffcream.
author: Melissa T.

description:
lol.
why bother.

it's nasty, they cannot make their drinks correctly. 
will not come back.
author: Anney T.

description: I am Matcha lover and after read many review that I should try Match Latte with puff cream so I can't wait to try it. Today I went to HiTea and I think I wait around 5 minute for the staff. They all in the kitchen I don't know what are they doing. I oredered Matcha Latte with puff cream. The taste is OK not bad but not that good. I didn't taste the flavor or puff cream so I dont know what it is taste like. Eveything taste blend all together and as I said "ok but not bad" but very difficult to explain the taste of this drink when my friend asked me.  Now I am feeling sick with my stomach.
author: Orange S.

description: I came here during their grand opening and was greeted by extremely friendly staff! I ordered a roasted oolong tea, and it was great! Wasn't too sweet and had a legitimate tea taste. Not only was the bubble tea delicious, but the boba shop also had a lounge area with cute decals on the wall. It's a great place just to hang out, or to study. Will definitely come back
author: Kimberly H.

description: Best milk tea in town ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!    Me and my bf came by on the afternoon on a Sunday night ..it was so crowed! And full of ppl in the rest area too! They have 4 comfortable table in the rest area for ppl who can sit and chill there . I remember that I order the assam milk tea with puffcream it wassssss so creamy and the milktea is just so fresh u can taste it was make with real milk but not powder!!!!! Highly recommend this!!! And it's just so special and u can get it no where els but here!!!! Definitely come back!!!!  Btw i am a milktea lover .and I had try almost every milk tea place in town and I can tell u that is the best milk tea place so far...
author: Hibby T.

description: I was passing by and saw that this place was having their grand opening. I stepped in and was greeted by friendly staff. I looked at the menu and was intrigued by the milk tea with puff cream.. mind you I had no idea what a puff cream was since no other milk tea place has it. The person taking my order was beyond patient explaining the difference between a puff cream and a milk foam. I finally settled on a green milk tea w puff cream and the drink is made fresh, no premade milk tea sitting around. It was not too sweet and you can really taste the quality of the ingredients they used. It didn't taste artificial or powdery like some places. Definitely give this place a try! Will come back whenever I'm in the area!
author: Lisa W.

description: Man worst milk tea ever. I ordered the African coco milk tea and it tasted like a water down ovatean drink. Girlfriend had a jasmine milk tea and it tastes watered down as well. Save yourself the money go and somewhere else.
author: Wayne K.

description: Great tea ,great service ,perfect snack shack.five stars all day long .best waffle fries in SF .
author: Tarif W.

description: This is the best boba place，and they have plenty of space for people who love to chat with each other and sit over there. when I order the drink，the cashier are very nicely to explain the drinks for me. I order the Uji matcha with the cheese milk foam，it taste very good. My friend order the assam milk tea with puff cream，she likes it. Finally，I will come back next time and try the other drinks！
author: Connie C.

description: Great new place for Milk Teas.  The menu is varied and not too similar to other places in Chinatown, so it's refreshing
author: Jonathan J.

description: Hi Tea became my new favorite milk tea place. Their drinks are so good, staffs are very friendly, and the decor is super cute and comfortable! I love this place!
author: C S.

description: Got the Jasmine Green as recommended & LOVE it!! A unique layout & with hand painted wall decor to admire! Service was awesome & friendly!
author: Tammy K.

description: I saw this place from the outside since their grand opening.  I didn't know what to think, so I went inside & ordered their 5-piece fried chickens. They were very small chicken bird size and it didn't really have that greasy fried to it.  I'm convinced.  I'll go for other items next time around.  It's kind of a spin-off on the coffee shop scene, but one thing that really stands out is the door attached to the wall that leads to nowhere (that I know of).  I love original ideas like this.  The wall is painted with cheerful notes, but that door on the wall is absolutely artsy.
author: BanBan B.

description:
A nice place and a frendly staff. Good price and tasty food.

(粤）環境裝修唔錯，友好0既員工。價錢適中，小食味道唔錯，值得返尋味。

(国)  环境和装修不错，员工很友好。价格适中，小吃的味道不错，值得再次光顾。
author: Peace M.

description: I order the West africa cocoa 30 percent. It is good and not to sweet but is the right taste. Is fine  waiting that long because they have seats and fresh air and good lighting in side that  comfy room. Is the best place to get your drink  .
author: Jay W.

description:
overcharged me and messed up on my order, yet I'm still giving a 3 stars? 3 stars for the customer service and a cute place. 

the cashier overcharged us for an Assam milk tea and a jasmine green milk tea with boba. I didn't realize I was overcharged until I got into the car and thought "wait! How was I charged almost $9 for two simple drinks when I could get for less price elsewhere?" that was not the price I saw on the menu. 

I really don't mind paying a bit more for good drinks. We went back and asked for a receipt. the owner (probably) said that I was charged for puff creama?! My initial reaction was WHAT IS THAT. the cashier charged me for something I don't even know what it is and i never asked for it. I usually make myself really clear when I order to avoid mistakes, but the girl still couldn't get my order right. but they refunded back the money which we weren't supposed to be charged :)

Drinks - they are ok. taste less light and less sweet, which is good for my liking. my jasmine milk tea is really green colored though. 

Now I'm sitting on my desk sipping on a drink I don't like with the puff creama for which I didn't request to put in. Only 1/5 into my drink and i wanna throw it away.. Hopefully the next time I return, they will have my order right and won't overcharge me.
author: Karen C.

description: Tried the royal milk tea and Assam milk tea. Probably the worst I've ever had. And they also falsely advertise their promotions. It is supposedly buy one get one 50% off but only gave us discount for half off a topping. Do not recommend at all
author: Emily L.

description: Cashier was patient on explaining the drinks but the people making the drinks were rather slow. We waited 15 minutes for 3 drinks and it was a HUGE disappointment. I got a jasmine green milk tea which tasted like watered down green tea with no milk or sweetener. My other two friends got their Assam milk tea which tasted just bad. Another friend got curly fries which was pretty good. Over all service was mediocre, drinks weren't good but food was okay. Oh and the boba was really bland too
author: Thomas M.

description: Stopped by at a pretty hot afternoon with my husband. It was such a good experience with Hitea. As soon as we came in , the stuff greet as with good manner. We were amazed by the decor on the wall. It was handed drawing. especially I love the drawing in the back with the buildings and the bridge. The sofa are so comfy too. For the drinks part, my husband ordered the Assam milk tea with puff cream . He is in love with it. The milk tea was fresh made with fresh milk. The texture was so smooth not like the other milk tea place having the powdery feeling. Adding the puff cream to the drink , made the drink more richer. He said if there is puff cream as topping. He would have put two extra puff cream in it. He just loves the puff cream.  I am always a mocha lover. I ordered uji matcha with milk foam. I can't say enough how I love this drink. The milk foam has very rich texture and it's very tasty. The matcha was so good too. We will come back for more often. So happy to find a good boba place in Chinatwon. Definitely recommend my friends to give a visit.
author: nellie z.

description: been a customer since they open，5 stars ，best choice，oreo iced milk tea is very tasty，should give it a try. clean place and very friendly staff
author: Jay W.
